column4: Anyone a clue why a HD with an install won't work on the one system and does work on the other system?
must have something to do whith that UUID...
Bios may map the drive differently on the two boxes for instance.
map the drive? what exactly does that mean?
One computer might see the drive with X heads X sectors X cylinders   but computer2 sees it like Y heads Y sectors Y cylinders

If you go into bios on the computer it works with and write down all the numbers for the drive, on computer2 put the drive in exact same spot on IDE and cable, in bios there, specify exactly heads,cylinders etc as you copied it from the one that works
i've checked, the new system (with a live cd by the way) with dumpe2fs, it gives me the same UUID
well, the same HD in the new system gives me the same UUID
At any rate, the uuid has nothing to do with the scenario i am saying.
I've an old system, took out the HD and put it in a new one. The HD in the new system, and boot gives me an error the install cannot be loaded, for the /dev/disk/by-uuid/UUID number is not found
sorry if i seem a little fuzzy :)
Ah, OK, that is more clear. Your original description given makes it like you removed the hd from one box, transplanted it to another and it was not working in the new box.
The OS installed fine to the new HD ut it is giving the uuid errors then
have not reinstalled, just migrated the HD :)
